intro: Chrysanthemum sylvaticum, commonly known as the woodland chrysanthemum, is a herbaceous perennial native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine, hairy pubescence. The plant produces clusters of small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow, white, and pale orange, which bloom in late summer to early autumn. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a slightly serrated edge. This species thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along streambanks.
